document.heading: Mortgage Lender and Broker Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-155, the “Mortgage Lender and Broker Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-637, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 1996, and June 4, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 19, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-309 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-155 became effective on September 9, 1996.
